title: NA
text: NEVER push directly main. changes must go PRs auto-merge:
code: # 1. Create feature branch git checkout -b fix/description-of-change  # 2. Make changes, commit git add -A git commit -m "Fix: description of change"  # 3. Push and create PR with auto-merge git push -u origin fix/description-of-change gh pr create --title "Fix: description" --body "Description of changes" gh pr merge --auto --squash  # 4. Clean up stale branches after PR merges git checkout main && git pull && git fetch --prune origin

title: NA
text: Clean stale branches every time touch package:
code: # Delete local branches merged to main git branch --merged main | grep -v main | xargs -r git branch -d  # Prune remote tracking branches git fetch --prune origin

title: NA
text: PRs auto-merge CI checks pass: - R-CMD-check (0 errors, 0 warnings) - Python tests (py{st}schooldata exists) - pkgdown build (vignettes must render) CI fails, fix issue push - auto-merge triggers checks pass.

title: NA
text: NEVER use man/figures/ generate_readme_figs.R README images. README images MUST come pkgdown-generated vignette output auto-update merge: : Vignette figures regenerate automatically pkgdown builds. Manual man/figures/ requires running separate script easy forget, causing stale/broken images.

title: NA
text: CRITICAL RULE (2026-01-08): code blocks README MUST match code vignette EXACTLY (1:1 correspondence).

title: NA
text: Idaho fix revealed critical bugs README code didn’t match vignettes: - Wrong district names (lowercase vs CAPS) - Text claims contradicted actual data - Missing data output examples

title: NA
text: Every story/section README MUST follow structure: Claim: factual statement data Explication: Brief explanation matters Code: R code fetches analyzes data (MUST exist vignette) Code Output: Data table/print statement showing actual values (REQUIRED) Visualization: Chart vignette (auto-generated pkgdown)

title: NA
text: state-deploy skill verifies deployment: - Extracts README code blocks - Searches vignettes EXACT matches - Fails deployment code found vignettes - Randomly audits packages claim accuracy

title: NA
text: ❌ Wrong district/entity names (case sensitivity, typos) ❌ Text claims contradict data ❌ Broken code fails silently ❌ Missing data output ✅ Verified, accurate, reproducible examples

title: NA
code: ### 1. State enrollment grew 28% since 2002  State added 68,000 students from 2002 to 2026, bucking national trends.  ```r library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2002:2026)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   filter(end_year %in% c(2002, 2026)) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round((n_students / lag(n_students) - 1) * 100, 1)) # Prints: 2002=XXX, 2026=YYY, change=ZZZ, pct=PP.P%

title: ERRATA: Known Data Access Issues
text: Date identified: January 2026 Issue: Arizona Department Education (ADE) website azed.gov implemented Cloudflare challenge-based protection blocks automated downloads enrollment data files. HTTP requests Excel file URLs return 403 Forbidden cf-mitigated: challenge headers, indicating browser-based CAPTCHA challenge required. Impact: - fetch_enr() fetch_enr_multi() download data directly ADE - vignette render live data automated builds - Package functionality requires manual data download cached data Technical details: protection applies file downloads azed.gov/sites/default/files/, including: - Oct1Enrollment*.xlsx files - Historical enrollment reports - Excel/CSV data exports Workarounds: Manual download: Download files manually ADE Accountability & Research Data page using web browser, use import_local_enr() (available) place files package cache directory. Browser automation: Use tools like Selenium Playwright automate browser-based downloads can complete Cloudflare challenges. Cached data: previously downloaded data, may stored package cache accessible without network requests. Status: Unresolved. Monitoring changes ADE’s Cloudflare configuration. ADE Contact: data access questions, contact dataoperations@azed.gov.
code: HTTP/2 403 cf-mitigated: challenge critical-ch: Sec-CH-UA-Bitness, Sec-CH-UA-Arch, ...

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
text: FERPA Suppression: Small cohorts (<11 students) redacted. Values show -1 -11. trendResult = -1: Indicates suppressed/redacted data numInCohort = -1: Indicates suppressed cohort size Rate Calculation: trendResult = (numGraduated / numInCohort) * 100

text: Create get_entity_list() - Fetch LEAs/schools fiscal year Create get_raw_grad() - Fetch graduation data one entity Create get_raw_grad_all() - Batch fetch entities (progress) Create process_grad() - Clean standardize column names Create tidy_grad() - Pivot long format subgroup column Create fetch_grad() - Main function caching Create fetch_grad_multi() - Multi-year convenience function Update caching - Add graduation cache types Add tests - Fidelity tests known values

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
code: # 1. Get list of all entities entities <- httr::GET(   "https://azreportcards.azed.gov/api/Entity/GetEntityList",   query = list(fiscalYear = 2024) )  # 2. For each entity, get graduation data grad_data <- httr::GET(   "https://azreportcards.azed.gov/api/DataApi/GetGradRateTrendData",   query = list(     educationOrganizationId = entity_id,     fiscalYear = 2024   ) )

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
text: documented rate limits Recommend 100ms delay calls politeness Batch fiscal year minimize API calls Use caching aggressively

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
code: test_that("FY2024 state graduation rate matches API", {   # From /api/DataApi/GetDetailsForState?fiscalYear=2024   # Expected: 77.86%   state_data <- fetch_grad(2024) |>     filter(entity_type == "state", subgroup == "All")   expect_equal(state_data$grad_rate, 77.86, tolerance = 0.01) })  test_that("FY2024 Mesa Unified graduation rate matches API", {   # educationOrganizationId = 4235   # Verify against direct API call   data <- fetch_grad(2024) |>     filter(entity_id == 4235, subgroup == "All")   expect_true(nrow(data) > 0)   expect_true(data$grad_rate > 0 & data$grad_rate <= 100) })  test_that("Subgroup data available for major districts", {   data <- fetch_grad(2024) |>     filter(entity_id == 4235)   subgroups <- unique(data$subgroup)   expect_true("All" %in% subgroups)   expect_true("Hispanic" %in% subgroups | "HL" %in% subgroups) })

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
code: test_that("Graduation rates are valid percentages", {   data <- fetch_grad(2024, tidy = TRUE)   valid_data <- data |> filter(!is.na(grad_rate) & grad_rate >= 0)   expect_true(all(valid_data$grad_rate >= 0))   expect_true(all(valid_data$grad_rate <= 100)) })  test_that("No missing entity names", {   data <- fetch_grad(2024)   expect_false(any(is.na(data$entity_name))) })  test_that("Suppressed values properly coded", {   data <- fetch_grad(2024)   suppressed <- data |> filter(redacted == 1)   # Suppressed records should have NA or -1 values   expect_true(all(suppressed$num_in_cohort <= 0 | is.na(suppressed$num_in_cohort))) })

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
code: test_that("API is accessible", {   skip_if_offline()   response <- httr::GET(     "https://azreportcards.azed.gov/api/DataApi/GetFiscalYears",     httr::timeout(30)   )   expect_equal(httr::status_code(response), 200) })  test_that("Entity list returns data", {   skip_if_offline()   response <- httr::GET(     "https://azreportcards.azed.gov/api/Entity/GetEntityList",     query = list(fiscalYear = 2024),     httr::timeout(60)   )   expect_equal(httr::status_code(response), 200)   data <- httr::content(response)   expect_gt(length(data), 500)  # Expect 600+ entities })

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
text: Arizona transitioned multiple assessment systems: AzMERIT (2015-2019), AzM2 (2020-2021), AASA (2022-present). Arizona Department Education maintains comprehensive assessment data Accountability & Research Data portal downloadable files organized year. Complexity Level: MEDIUM - Multiple assessment system transitions, good data availability clear documentation

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
code: - school_year (e.g., "2023-2024") - district_code - district_name - school_code - school_name - grade_level (3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 11 for science) - subject ("ELA", "Mathematics", "Science") - tested_count - performance_level_counts:   - minimally_proficient_count   - partially_proficient_count   - proficient_count   - highly_proficient_count - proficiency_rate (Level 3 + Level 4) - subgroup (All, Asian, Black, Hispanic, White, etc.) - economic_status - ell_status - special_education_status

previous_headings: Data Structure Analysis > Expected Schema Elements (Based on AzMERIT/AASA Patterns)
title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
text: AzMERIT (2015-2019): - Minimally Proficient (Level 1) - Partially Proficient (Level 2) - Proficient (Level 3) - Highly Proficient (Level 4) AASA (2022-present): - 4-level structure - Proficient = Level 3 + Level 4 Verification Required: Actual column names structure must verified downloaded Excel files.

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
text: Based Arizona reporting federal requirements: Race/Ethnicity: - Asian - Black/African American - Hispanic/Latino - Native American/American Indian - Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander - White - Multiple Races Subgroups: - Economically Disadvantaged - English Learners - Students Disabilities - Male/Female - Migrant - Homeless - Foster Care - Military Connected Note: Small cell sizes may suppressed privacy (FERPA).

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
text: Major Transitions: 1. 2019-2020: AzMERIT → AzM2 (pandemic disruption) 2. 2020-2021: Pandemic year (assessments waived) 3. 2021-2022: AzM2 → AASA (renamed) 4. Assessment System Changes: AzMERIT, AzM2, AASA may different scales Comparison Warnings: - 2015-2019 vs. 2022+: Different assessment systems (AzMERIT vs. AASA) - limited comparability - 2021: Pandemic-affected data - use caution - Trend analysis: reliable within assessment system

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
text: Research/Analysis: - AzMERIT Era: 2015-2019 (pre-pandemic baseline) - AASA Era: 2022-present (current system) - 2021: Treat outlier (pandemic recovery) Implementation: - Focus AASA (2022-present) primary current series - Include AzMERIT (2015-2019) historical series - Exclude 2020 (data) - Treat 2021 caution (transition year, pandemic-affected)

title: Arizona School Data Expansion Research
text: Arizona assessment data technically feasible moderate complexity due : Clear data portal downloadable Excel files Multiple assessment system transitions (AzMERIT → AzM2 → AASA) Pandemic-related data gap (2020) Excel file format (standard parsing) Historical archive available Recommended Approach: 1. Implement AASA (2022-present) current series 2. Add AzMERIT (2015-2019) historical series 3. Document potentially non-comparable systems 4. Handle pandemic years appropriately Complexity Rating: 5/10 (Medium complexity due assessment system transitions) Estimated Implementation Effort: 15-25 hours (file download investigation, schema documentation, function development, testing)

title: TODO: azschooldata
text: Date identified: 2026-01-01 Status: Mitigated pkgdown builds; data access still blocked Issue: Arizona Department Education website (azed.gov) Cloudflare challenge-based protection blocks programmatic downloads. HTTP requests Excel file URLs return 403 Forbidden cf-mitigated: challenge headers. pkgdown Fix Applied: - Vignette enrollment_hooks.Rmd now uses eval=FALSE skip code execution builds - Created ERRATA.md documenting data access issue - allows pkgdown build successfully without network access Remaining Work: 1. Monitor ADE website changes Cloudflare configuration 2. Consider adding sample/cached data offline usage 3. Explore browser automation (Selenium/Playwright) alternative download method 4. Contact ADE (dataoperations@azed.gov) programmatic access options See also: ERRATA.md full technical details.

title: Arizona School Enrollment Data
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2018, 2024, 2025), use_cache = TRUE)  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 2))  state_totals #>   end_year n_students  change pct_change #> 1     2018    1112682      NA         NA #> 2     2024    2230271 1117589     100.44 #> 3     2025    2199141  -31130      -1.40 ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#BF0A30") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#BF0A30") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Arizona Public School Enrollment (2018-2024)",     subtitle = "Growth has slowed in recent years",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

title: Arizona School Enrollment Data
code: gender_by_year <- enr |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("male", "female")) |>   select(end_year, subgroup, n_students) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = subgroup, values_from = n_students)  gender_by_year #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   end_year    male  female #>      <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1     2018  570750  541889 #> 2     2024 1136269 1093826 #> 3     2025 1119644 1079300 enr |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("male", "female")) |>   mutate(pct = n_students / n_students[subgroup == "total_enrollment"][1] * 100,          subgroup = ifelse(subgroup == "male", "Male", "Female")) |>   ggplot(aes(x = end_year, y = pct, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Male" = "#0072B2", "Female" = "#CC79A7")) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = function(x) paste0(x, "%")) +   labs(     title = "Gender Distribution Over Time",     x = "School Year",     y = "Percentage",     fill = "Gender"   )

title: Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: package uses data Arizona Department Education October 1 enrollment reports. Currently available years: 2018, 2024, 2025 Missing years: 2019-2023 (Excel files available automated downloads - Cloudflare protection blocks programmatic access) Data included: - State totals grade level gender - District school totals - County-level aggregates information, see package README function documentation.

previous_headings: What can you find with azschooldata?
what: Gender balance holds steady across Arizona schools
title: Arizona School Data
text: Arizona’s public schools maintain near-equal enrollment male female students.
code: library(azschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2018, 2024))  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("male", "female")) %>%   select(end_year, subgroup, n_students) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = subgroup, values_from = n_students) %>%   mutate(pct_male = male / (male + female) * 100) # A tibble: 2 x 3   end_year  female    male      <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> 1     2018  541889  570750 2     2024 1093826 1136269

title: Arizona School Data
code: library(azschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # State totals enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("hispanic", "white", "black", "asian", "native_american")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Arizona School Data
code: import pyazschooldata as az  # Fetch one year enr_2024 = az.fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = az.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # State totals state_total = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # District breakdown districts = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)  # Demographics demographics = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (enr_2024['subgroup'].isin(['hispanic', 'white', 'black', 'asian', 'native_american'])) ][['subgroup', 'n_students', 'pct']]

what: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school enrollment data Arizona Department Education (ADE). Provides functions fetching October 1 enrollment data Accountability & Research division transforming tidy format analysis.

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Arizona uses following ID system: Entity IDs (CTDSNumber): Variable length numeric IDs LEAs schools Entity names identify whether district, charter, school

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Arizona Department Education: Accountability & Research: https://www.azed.gov/accountability-research/data October 1 Enrollment Reports published annually

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Data available 2011 present: Era 1 (2011-2017): Original Excel format multiple tabs Era 2 (2018-2023): Updated format FY notation demographic breakdowns Era 3 (2024-present): Simplified naming convention Note: Historical data 1990s-2000s exists PDF reports currently supported package.

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com

what: Fetch Arizona school directory data — fetch_directory
title: Fetch Arizona school directory data — fetch_directory
text: Downloads processes school directory data Arizona Department Education Report Cards. Includes schools districts contact information.

title: Fetch Arizona school directory data — fetch_directory
code: fetch_directory(   end_year = NULL,   tidy = TRUE,   use_cache = TRUE,   include_contact = TRUE )

title: Fetch Arizona school directory data — fetch_directory
text: end_year Fiscal year end (default: current year). Data returned schools/districts active fiscal year. tidy TRUE (default), returns data standardized format consistent column names. FALSE, returns raw column names API. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download ADE. include_contact TRUE (default), fetches contact details (admin name, phone, website) entity. Set FALSE faster download basic info .

title: Fetch Arizona school directory data — fetch_directory
text: tibble school directory data. Columns include: state_school_id: ADE education organization ID (schools) state_district_id: ADE education organization ID (districts/LEAs) school_name: School name district_name: District/LEA name school_type: Type (e.g., "District School", "Charter School") entity_type: Entity level ("School" "LEA") grades_served: Grade range (e.g., "Kindergarten - Grade 12") is_title1: Title status phone: Phone number (include_contact = TRUE) website: School/district website (include_contact = TRUE) principal_name: Administrator name (include_contact = TRUE)

title: Fetch Arizona school directory data — fetch_directory
text: directory data retrieved ADE Report Cards API. data represents schools districts specified fiscal year updated annually ADE. Note: Physical addresses (street, city, zip) available API. need address data, consider using state data sources.

title: Fetch Arizona school directory data — fetch_directory
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get school directory data for current year dir_data <- fetch_directory()  # Get raw format (original API column names) dir_raw <- fetch_directory(tidy = FALSE)  # Fast download without contact details dir_basic <- fetch_directory(include_contact = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) dir_fresh <- fetch_directory(use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to schools only library(dplyr) schools_only <- dir_data |>   filter(entity_type == "School")  # Find all schools in a district mesa_schools <- dir_data |>   filter(grepl("Mesa", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          entity_type == "School") } # }

title: Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Arizona Department Education's October 1 enrollment reports.

title: Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2018-2026. Data availability notes: Excel files available FY2018 (end_year 2018) onwards Older data (2011-2017) may available manual requests ADE Earlier years (1990s-2000s) exist PDF reports supported ADE uses varying URL patterns across years; download may take seconds package tries multiple URL patterns tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download ADE.

title: Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Get historical data from 2018 enr_2018 <- fetch_enr(2018)  # Filter to specific district phoenix_union <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(grepl("Phoenix Union", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)). Valid range 2018-2026. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Get full available range enr_all <- fetch_enr_multi(2018:2025)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years

text: Returns range school years enrollment data available Arizona Department Education.

title: Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years
Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years
text: list three elements: min_year earliest available school year end (e.g., 2011 2010-11) max_year latest available school year end (e.g., 2024 2023-24) description Human-readable description data availability

title: Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2018 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2024 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Arizona enrollment data is available from 2017-18 (end_year 2018) through 2023-24 (end_year 2024). Data comes from the October 1 enrollment reports published by the Arizona Department of Education. Older data (2011-2017) may be available through manual requests to ADE. Earlier years (1990s-2000s) exist only as PDF reports and are not currently supported." #>  # Returns list with min_year, max_year, and description

title: azschooldata 0.1.0
text: Initial release Enrollment data available 2003-2025 (22 years) Data sourced directly Arizona Department Education Supports school, district, state-level aggregations Race/ethnicity gender subgroup breakdowns available Python wrapper (pyazschooldata) included cross-language access
